Lessons learnt from Plucking Chickens

for loops introduce variables only for the purpose of keeping position, and the total count
introduced two variables (chicken, feathers) that will escape the scope of the for loop into the outer function scope

the function given to map creates a new scope keeping our temporary variable in check
all the variables we need are required by the function signature, and given to us, so we don’t have to keep track of them manually

lessons:
for loops are messy
iteration/temporary variables can be accidentally override if not careful
intentions are obscured by the how instead of the what
